humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has metastases in 12 out of 19 lymph nodes (12/19), which corresponds to N3 stage according to the AJCC staging system (New Rule 13). This is also supported by the pathology report's notation of 'pN3a'.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for cancer staging is determined by the number of lymph nodes involved and the location of the metastases. In this report, the patient has metastatic carcinoma in 12 out of 19 lymph nodes (12/19), with extracapsular extension present. This meets the criteria for N3a. The highest apical node is also involved, which is consistent with N3. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N3.
